Develop.
Modify.
Integrate.
Rollout.
An open-source web user interface component library based on inline CSS.
Explore the first web UI framework that integrates inline CSS at its core, offering you greater flexibility and empowerment.
Rooven components
offer versatility.
Highly adaptable
Use Rooven UI components independently to build your app from scratch, or integrate them with any framework or library to complement your toolkit. Whether on their own or alongside other technologies, Rooven adapts to your workflow and preferences.
Build apps that are
inherently fast.
Driven by excellence
Develop applications that are naturally quick and efficient by design. By incorporating lean architecture, minimalistic design, and streamlined processes, the UI of applications made with Rooven ensures lightning-fast performance and immediate responsiveness.
We conducted thorough
tests on Rooven
It performed exceptionally well on the frameworks, libraries, and runtimes you love.
"Design system lays the groundwork,
creativity
builds the masterpiece."
- Allen Casul
| Creator & Founder

Component
 
            
<section>
  <div id="app"></div>
  
  <script>
    const render = document.getElementById('app');

    async function getData() {
      try {
        const URL       = "https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/users";
        const response  = await fetch(URL, { method: "GET" });
        const json      = await response.json();

        let output = "";
        for (let data of json) {
          output +=
          `
            <section>
              <div style="display: grid; background-color: var(--card-adaptive-scheme);">
                <a href="#..." class="__hover">
                  <div style="width: 100%; height: 62px; display: flex; align-items: center; column-gap: .8rem; padding: 0.8rem;">
                    <div style="position: relative; display: flex; align-items: center;">
                      <img style="object-fit: cover; width: 2.4rem; height: 2.4rem; background-color: var(--skeleton-adaptive-scheme); border-radius: var(--radius-septenary);" src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/allencasul/rooven-framework-official-website@master/src/client/assets/img/webp/man.webp" loading="lazy" alt="Profile">
                      <div style="position: absolute; right: 0; bottom: 0; width: 0.9rem; height: 0.9rem; background-color: var(--card-adaptive-scheme); border-radius: var(--radius-septenary); display: grid; place-content: center;">
                        <div style="width: 0.6rem; height: 0.6rem; background-color: var(--online); border-radius: var(--radius-septenary);"></div>
                      </div>
                    </div>     
                    <div style="display: grid;">
                      <div style="max-width: 240px; font-size: var(--font-size-xl); font-weight: 700; color: var(--title-adaptive-scheme); line-height: 19px; white-space: nowrap; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">${data.name}</div>
                      <div style="max-width: 240px; font-size: var(--font-size-ml); font-weight: 400; color: var(--gray); line-height: 19px; white-space: nowrap; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">${data.company.catchPhrase}</div>
                    </div>
                  </div>
                </a>
              </div>
            </section>
          `;
        }
        render.innerHTML = output;
      }
      catch (error) {
        alert("Error: " + error);
      }
    } getData();
  </script>
</section>
Why
Rooven?
account_tree
Uncluttered
Designed to be lightweight, which means it provides essential styling and components without unnecessary bloat.
build_circle
Customization
It provides a solid foundation but allows developers to tailor styles and components to their specific needs.
layers
Component Library
Has a comprehensive set of UI components, including dialogs, lists, chat bubble, navigations and many more.
folder_code
JavaScript Dependencies
HTML & CSS-only, with minimal JavaScript. It’s suitable for projects where you want to avoid heavy JS dependencies.
OTP
Component
 
            
<section>
  <div style="width: 100%; height: 100dvh; display: grid; place-content: center; background-color: var(--card-adaptive-scheme); padding: 1.5rem;">
    <div style="display: grid; row-gap: 1rem; text-align: center; margin-bottom: 2rem;">
      <span style="color: var(--info); font-size: var(--font-size-15xl);" class="material-symbols-outlined">lock</span>
      <div style="font-size: var(--font-size-6xl); font-weight: 700; color: var(--title-adaptive-scheme);">Account Verification</div>
      <div style="font-size: var(--font-size-ml); font-weight: 400; color: var(--description-adaptive-scheme);">We sent a 5-digit authentication code to sample@gmail.com. Please check your email and put the code below.</div>
    </div>
    <div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; gap: 1rem; margin-bottom: 2rem;">
      <input style="width: 45px; height: 45px; font-size: var(--font-size-6xl); font-weight: 900; text-align: center; border: 1px solid var(--border); border-radius: var(--radius-secondary); color-scheme: light dark;" class="__otp-input __first-otp-input __custom-input-outline" type="number" maxlength="1" aria-label="input">
      <input style="width: 45px; height: 45px; font-size: var(--font-size-6xl); font-weight: 900; text-align: center; border: 1px solid var(--border); border-radius: var(--radius-secondary); color-scheme: light dark;" class="__otp-input __custom-input-outline" type="number" maxlength="1" aria-label="input">
      <input style="width: 45px; height: 45px; font-size: var(--font-size-6xl); font-weight: 900; text-align: center; border: 1px solid var(--border); border-radius: var(--radius-secondary); color-scheme: light dark;" class="__otp-input __custom-input-outline" type="number" maxlength="1" aria-label="input">
      <input style="width: 45px; height: 45px; font-size: var(--font-size-6xl); font-weight: 900; text-align: center; border: 1px solid var(--border); border-radius: var(--radius-secondary); color-scheme: light dark;" class="__otp-input __custom-input-outline" type="number" maxlength="1" aria-label="input">
      <input style="width: 45px; height: 45px; font-size: var(--font-size-6xl); font-weight: 900; text-align: center; border: 1px solid var(--border); border-radius: var(--radius-secondary); color-scheme: light dark;" class="__otp-input __custom-input-outline" type="number" maxlength="1" aria-label="input">
    </div>
    <div style="display: grid; place-items: center; row-gap: 2rem; text-align: center;">
      <button>Validate</button>
      <div style="font-size: var(--font-size-m); font-weight: 400; color: var(--placeholder-adaptive-scheme);">Didn't receive the code? 
        <a style="font-size: var(--font-size-m); font-weight: 500; color: var(--info);" href="#">Resend</a>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
  <script>
    const otpInput = document.querySelectorAll(".__otp-input");
    const firstOTPInput = document.querySelector(".__first-otp-input");
      
    otpInput.forEach((input, index) => {
      firstOTPInput.focus(); 
      input.addEventListener("input", () => {
        if (input.value.length === 1 && index < otpInput.length - 1) { 
          otpInput[index + 1].focus(); 
        }
        input.addEventListener("keydown", (e) => { 
          if (e.key === "Backspace" && input.value.length === 0 && index > 0) { 
            otpInput[index - 1].focus();
          } 
        });
      });
    });
  </script>
</section>
lock
Account Verification
We sent a 5-digit authentication code to sample@gmail.com. Please check your email and put the code below.
Validate
Didn't receive the code? Resend
What about
Performance?
dynamic_form
Load Time
Tends to load faster due to its lightweight nature. It includes only essential styles and components.
electric_bolt
Rendering Speed
Rely primarily on CSS for styling, which generally results in faster rendering.
handyman
Customization Overhead
Allows easy customization, so you can remove or modify components without much overhead.
linked_services
Browser Compatibility
Compatible with modern browsers, such as Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Opera, and Brave.

Rooven's 70+
Components
Accordion 1stat_minus_1
A lightweight and responsive accordion component designed to organize content in collapsible sections.
Accordion 2stat_minus_1
A sleek accordion UI widget featuring customizable styles and animations. Perfect for displaying FAQs, menus, or collapsible content with a professional touch.
Accordion 3stat_minus_1
A dynamic accordion component that allows users to expand or collapse multiple sections simultaneously. Ideal for enhancing user experience in data-heavy interfaces.
Accordion
Accordion is a great way to organize and display content in a compact and interactive manner, allowing you to present content in collapsible sections.
Avatar
Avatar component is used to represent a user or entity visually. It often displays a profile picture or an icon that serves as an identifiable marker within the user interface.

A bottom navigation is a design element to provide easy access to the main sections or features of the app. It contains several icons or text labels that represent different sections or pages within the app.

Bottom Sheet
A bottom sheet displays additional content, options, or actions without navigating away from the current screen. It is useful for presenting contextual information or actions without disrupting the user's workflow.

Button
Button is an interactive element in a digital interface that allows users to perform specific actions when clicked or tapped. Buttons are essential in guiding user interaction and making the interface intuitive and user-friendly.

Badge
Badge is a small visual element used in user interfaces to display a count, status, or label. Badges are often used to draw attention to specific items, such as notifications, messages, updates, or status indicators.

A card is a visually appealing element used to group related information compactly and accessibly. It presents content in an easy-to-scan and interactive format, containing text, images, buttons, and other interactive elements.

Chat Bubble
A chat bubble, used in messaging apps and chat interfaces, displays individual messages by encapsulating text, images, or other content, making conversations easy to follow and engage with.

Chip
Chip is a small UI element representing an attribute, entity, or action. Versatile in nature, chips are used for displaying contact information, filtering content, or representing selections.

Code Snippet
Code snippet is used to display formatted code within an application or website. It provides a way to present code in a readable and visually appealing manner, often including syntax highlighting and line numbers.
Copy to Clipboard
A copy-to-clipboard element lets users copy text or content with a single click or tap, offering a quick and easy way to copy information without manual selection.

Dashboard
A dashboard component is a graphical representation that provides a summary view of key information and metrics, typically for a specific application or system. It's designed to be a central hub where users can quickly access and visualize important data in a clear and concise manner.

Dialog
Dialog is a small window that appears in the foreground of an application, used to provide information, ask for input, or present options. It temporarily takes focus away from the main content and requires user interaction to close or proceed.

Dropdown
Dropdown is a graphical control element that allows users to select one option from a list of choices. It's commonly used in forms, navigation menus, and filters to provide a space-efficient way to present multiple options.
person_add
Floating Action Button
A Floating Action Button (FAB) is a circular button that floats above the UI and highlights the main action users are likely to take, such as adding a new item, composing a message, or initiating a search.

OTP/Verification Input
An OTP (One-Time Password) or verification UI component is an interface element used to verify a user's identity by sending a unique code, typically via SMS, email, or an authentication app.

Pagination
Pagination is a navigational tool used to divide large sets of content or data into separate pages. It helps manage and display information in a more organized and digestible manner.
Preloader
Preloader help improve the user experience by providing feedback that the application is working, thereby reducing uncertainty and frustration during wait times.
Progress
Progress is used to visually indicate the progress of a task or process. It's essential for enhancing user experience by informing users about the ongoing activities, such as file uploads, downloads, data processing, or installations.
Skeleton
Skeleton is a placeholder element that mimics the layout and structure of the content that will eventually be displayed. It provides users with a visual representation of the expected content while the actual data is being loaded.

Table
Table is a structured layout element used to display data in rows and columns, providing an organized and easily readable format. It is commonly used in various applications to present information systematically, making it easy to compare and analyze data.

Toast
Toast is a small, non-intrusive message that briefly appears on the screen to provide feedback to the user. It's typically used to convey success, error, or informational messages without interrupting the user's workflow.

Top navigation is a horizontal menu typically located at the top of an application interface. It provides users with easy access to the main sections or features of the site or app, enhancing navigation and usability.

Text Field
Text field is an input element that allows users to enter, edit, and interact with text within an application or website. It's a fundamental part of forms and user interfaces, enabling users to provide information, perform searches, or input data.
